95273.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵１巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 1 was held in.
According to the booklet, the real Aztech Soldier's head contains an artificial intelligence that allows autonomous behavior.
An experiment was conducted where the AI was used mediate interests between organizations and to reconcile a husband and wife.
For some reason, the former succeeded, but the latter failed...

95535.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵２巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 2 was held in.
According to the booklet, the Urbea Aztech's right arm has a beam cannon that emits a high powered beam.
"The beam was fired at the moon during the start of the year, and caused a new crater to form!", observed information says.

95781.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵３巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 3 was held in.
According to the booklet, the Aztech has a huge axe attached to its left arm, but can also be attached with a beam cannon.
Aztechs programmed with warlike AI tend to prefer the axe for close quarters, and the beam cannon for ranged support.
At the front lines where equipment is in short supply, records say that Aztechs would fight over one axe until they were destroyed.

96143.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵４巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 4 was held in.
According to the booklet, the Aztech has a mysterious space inside it where people can enter.
It seems there was a plan to freeze and store bodies inside the Aztechs, which this space is a remnant of.
Things like meat and vegetables can last longer than in room temperature storage by using this space.
There are also Aztechs that specialize in the transportation of food.

96476.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵５巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 5 was held in.
According to the booklet, the Aztech's legs use an anti-gravity technology, and will not fall on even the roughest roads.
The Minister of Finance consulted with the Empire Tech Agency and asked, "If they can float, do they need legs?" to curb war costs.
The proposal was a horizontal spear of sorts, but the Tech Agency immediately abolished the idea with backlash.
The Minster was worried about the loss of legs, but afterwards he was sent to the front lines and died honorably in the war...

96872.<pc>は 週刊ウルベア魔神兵６巻に\n付属しているブ厚い箱の 上部に貼りついた:
read the thin booklet attached to the box the Weekly Urbea Aztech Vol. 6 was held in.
According to the booklet, the Aztech's legs use a hovering function to dramatically shorten travel time.
This hovering is useful for retreating battles if needed. However, malfunctions in AI caused some to go behind enemy lines and not return.
Theories say the fugitive Aztechs are waiting to take revenge on their creator, who started an irrational war from the village he built...

97347.<pc>は 磁気式図書購入札を\nかるく 折り曲げてみた。\n<br>\n手をは:

105259.<pc>は ドミネウスの回顧録を\n手に取って 読んでみた。\n<br>\n「マ:
picked up Domineus' Memoir and began reading it.
"I met Myna during a tour of the Royal Capital. She was a commoner, but perhaps because we were both young, the difference
in our statuses did not matter at all."
"We made love, and soon had a daughter. I gave them a house near the castle for them to live in. They lived in modest happiness."
"But...Myna died. The Time Guidebook told her to kill herself for the future of Ethene."
"I suspected it was the king's doing. Father was not fond of Myna. Did he tamper with the guidelines to send her to her death?"
"So, I secretly consulted the Timeseer Box. However, it was revealed that not even the king could tamper with the prophecy."
"Fate can be so cruel... did her death bring about a better future? Did she really have to die?!"
"Only the Timeseer Box understood my pain. I followed the guidelines, met the princess, and eventually, my interest in Myna and her
daughter faded away..."
